info.title: API Documentation V
info.description:
Welcome to the API documentation. This guide provides detailed information on how to integrate and interact with the system through its API. # Introduction Our API (Application Programming Interface) enables developers to leverage Hailo's features programmatically, integrating ERP capabilities seamlessly into your own applications, services, and workflows.

Key Features

  • Unified Platform: Hailo offers a unified platform for managing various aspects of enterprise operations, including product, orders and more.
  • Scalable and Customizable:
  • Real-time Data Sync: The API facilitates real-time data synchronization, ensuring that your applications always have access to the most up-to-date information.
# Getting Started To begin using the API, you'll need to understanding response structure , exceptions and errors
Dates and date times, unless otherwise specified, must be in the [RFC 3339](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339) format.
# Response structure Responses from the API are always JSON.

Successful Request Response

All responses from the API server are JSON with the content-type application/json unless explicitly stated otherwise. A successful 200 OK response always has a JSON response body with a success key with the value boolen true. The data & message key contains the full response payload and message conveyed by api respectivly.
HTTP / 1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json

Preview

{ "success": true, "data": {}, "error": null, "message": "Success message" }

Failed Request Response

A failure response is preceded by the corresponding 40x or 50x HTTP header. The status key in the response envelope contains the value error. The message key contains a textual description of the error and error contains the datails of the error. There may be an optional data key with additional payload.
HTTP / 1.1 500 Server error
Content-Type: application/json

Preview

{ "success": false, "data": null, "error": {}, "message": "Error message" }
# Data types Values in JSON responses are of types string, int, float, or bool. Timestamp (datetime) strings in the responses are represented in the form yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss, set under the Indian timezone (IST) â€” UTC+5.5 hours. A date string is represented in the form yyyy-mm-dd.

post.description: Endpoint for user login. Accepts credentials and returns a JWT token if the login is successful

password.description: The user's password, must be at least 8 characters long, contain at least one number and one alphabet.

post.description: Endpoint for user logout. Accepts credentials and invalidate a JWT token if the logout is successfull.
Endpoint for user registration. Accepts credentials and returns a unique user id, if the registration is successfull

password.description: The user's password, must be at least 8 characters long, contain at least one number and one alphabet.

post.description: Endpoint for checking authorization of user.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number to retrieve, starting from 1.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The number of items to retrieve per page.

examples: Screen Resolution and Brightness: 360*360, 500 Nits Daylight-Bright Display, 2.5D Curved Glass
Health Monitoring: SpO2, 24*7 Heart Rate Monitoring, Blood Pressure, High Heart Rate Alert
Smart Controls: Remote Camera and Music Player
Bluetooth Calling with inbuilt mic, speaker and dialer
